title: Applying an Opportunity-Building Model for Improving English e-Learning Courses

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level specialized knowledge in the field and extensive practical experience
context.additional_context: Digital device-based learning environment, project-based assessment, intermediate-level learners, and diverse professional backgrounds

learning_goals: Learners can extract core keywords with over 80% accuracy by analyzing text-mining-based materials provided in e-learning courses.
Learners can generate at least three visualization scenarios reflecting abstract learning styles using KeyGraph technology.
Learners can identify at least five "opportunity factors" in their learning patterns and propose improvement strategies by applying Grounded Theory methodology.
Learners can derive at least three actionable strategies for course improvement by evaluating the ARCS model (Attention, Relevance, Confidence, Satisfaction).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
